narrative.narrative: Azul Linhas Areas Brasileiras S/A is a Brazilian domestic low-cost airline based in Barueri. It was established on May 5, 2008 by Brazilian-born David Neeleman, founder and former-CEO of JetBlue. The airline began service on December 15, 2008 and has ordered a fleet of 76 Embraer 195 jets. The company was named Azul after a naming contest in 2008, where 'Samba' was the other popular name.
